sense.gloss: parade float decorated with long-handled Chinese spears
focus (of one's attack, criticism, etc.), aim, target, brunt
kamaboko, steamed seasoned fish paste, usu. in a semicylindrical shape on a strip of wood and sliced to go in soup, etc.
shachihoko, shachi, mythical animal with the head of a lion and the body of a fish
roof ornament in the shape of a shachihoko (believed to provide protection against fire by causing rain to fall)
festival float mounted with a decorative halberd
to stiffen up (the nerves), to be tense
bronze hoko, bronze halberd, bronze spearhead

sdata.j: ↑川越↑↓かわごし↓の↑山車↑↓だし↓は、いわゆる↑鉾↑↓ほこ↓↑山車↑↓だし↓と↑呼↑↓よ↓ばれる↑形↑↓かたち↓で、↑車輪↑↓しゃりん↓が3つ、もしくは4つ↑付↑↓つ↓いています。
sdata.e: The Kawagoe festival float has the shape of what's called a hoko float. It has three, or four, wheels attached.

sdata.j: 「↑美味↑↓おい↓しそうな↑蒲鉾↑↓かまぼこ↓みっけ。↑食↑↓た↓べていい？」「ダメよ。お↑節用↑↓せちよう↓なんだから」「けち」
sdata.e: “Ooh, those fish cakes look tasty! Can I try them?” “No, don’t! They’re for New Year’s!” “Jeez, stingy much?”

words.gloss: kamaboko, steamed seasoned fish paste, usu. in a semicylindrical shape on a strip of wood and sliced to go in soup, etc.
